definitions.body: wrap oneself, enwrap envelop oneself (Ar. gat.a0 cover, conceal; Aram. 9t.o0 extinguish, destroy; As. eṭû, be dark, eṭûtu, darkness);—

wrap, envelop oneself with sthg. (acc., like [[לכשׁ]]): [[וְהוּא עׂטֶה מְעִיל]] 1Sa 28:14 an old man ascending, and he is enwrapped in a robe; so [[הָרׂעֶה בִּגְדוֹ]] ´[[יַע]] Je 43:12 (sim), and [[אֶת־אֶרֶץ]] ´[[וְע]] [[מִחְרֵיִם]] v:Je 43:12 he will wrap himself in the land of Egypt (use it as a robe, fig., of Nebuchadnezzar; so completely will it be in his power, Gf); so fig. of ´[[י]], [[וַיַּעַטַ כַּמְעִיל קִנְאָה]] Is 59:17 ( ‖[[לָבַשׁ ]]), [[־אוֹר כַּשַּׁלְמָה]]´[[ע]] Ps 104:2; of men, ´[[כְּבֶגֶד יַע]] Ps 109:19 (sim. ‖[[לָבַשׁ]] v:Ps 109:18), [[כַמְעִיל בָּשְׁתָּם]] ´[[וְיַע]] v:Ps 109:29 (‖ id.), ´[[יַע]] ´[[חָרְפָּה וגי]] Ps 71:13; c. [[עַל]] of part covered, in phrase [[וְעָטוּ עַל־שָׂפָם]] Mic 3:7 they shall envelop themselves upon their beard (cover the beard, sign of mourning or shame Che Now Benz:Arch.165 Now:Arch. i. 195), so Ez Eze 24:17, Eze 24:22 (of leper) Le 13:45 (P); pt. f. [[עׂטְיׇה]] Ct So 1:7 as subst., one wrapping ( a veil about her), i.e. a mourner; > a harlot (cf. Ge 38:14); but rd. perh. [[טׂעֲיׇה]] wandering woman, v. [[טעה]].—[[וַיַּעַט]] etc., v. [[עיט]]; [[מְעֻטָּה]] etc., v. also [[עיט]].
